attributes.action: Return Britain to defending freedom of speech, instead of suppressing it.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
The recent expulsion of Geert Wilders shows how Britain has changed in the 20 years since it stood by people such as Salman Rushdie, and defended their right to make criticism of religion(s).
Now our government has taken actively a suppressing such discussion, for fear of violent reaction.

rejection.details:
Overlaps with: http://petitions.number10.gov.uk/FreeHate/

Geert Wilder: Individual legal cases are a matter for direct communication with the Home Office.
reasons: Duplicate - this is similar to and/or overlaps with an existing petition or petitions
Outside the remit of the Prime Minister and Government
